body: I see, I'll run it against M6 once it hits central, thanks!

Already available at
http://central.maven.org/maven2/org/junit/jupiter/junit-jupiter-engine/5.0.0-M6

On Wed, Jul 19, 2017 at 1:12 AM, Michael Wei <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I see, I'll run it against M6 once it hits central, thanks!
>

Great, I can confirm this is resolved in M6. Thanks for the quick response.

You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub [https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/965#issuecomment-316225623] , or mute the thread [https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AGMi2IcJk47pktjG3zxuUApCtGP1a9w5ks5sPT1CgaJpZM4Ob_5C] .

Note: it works with M5, too.

```
java
-ea
-jar
  junit-platform-console-standalone\junit-platform-console-standalone-1.0.0-M5.jar
--class-path
  target\build\classes
--scan-classpath
.
+-- JUnit Jupiter [OK]
| +-- Tests [OK]
| | +-- testMapOfStrings(Map) [OK]
(...)
```
Note 2: use a library like https://github.com/jhalterman/typetools to retrieve runtime type information
Reopening this issue since I have been able to reproduce the exception on 5.0 M6.
